userreviews.userReview: Discussing the famous interview of Jonas Salk by Edward R. Murrow briefly, but mostly concerned with the disease, the vaccine, and the March of Dimes. Title should read, "The History of Polio in the US."
Interesting read - also about polio - but did not flow as well as Polio: An American Story.

description: For half a century the specter of polio stalked the nightmares of every parent. This richly detailed account of the development of a successful vaccine against polio describes how a small laboratory experiment became a national event of a size and complexity never seen before.
title: Patenting The Sun: Polio and the Salk Vaccine
